meanings.definition: The action of flowing or flowing out.
meanings.sent1: The fluxions of the river carried the leaves downstream.
meanings.sent2: I observed the fluxions of water as it poured from the faucet.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chased after the fluxions of water from the hose.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like the fluxions of a river, constantly changing and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the beauty of the fluxions in the painting, depicting the movement of water with precision.

meanings.sent1: The fluxions of the clouds created a mesmerizing pattern in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The city skyline was a testament to the constant fluxions of urban development.
meanings.sent3: The fluxions of the dance performance kept the audience captivated.
meanings.sent4: Time is a river of fluxions, always moving forward and never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The fluxions of the market prices made it difficult to predict future trends.

meanings.definition: A state of constant change or instability.
meanings.sent1: Living in a state of fluxions can be both exciting and challenging.
meanings.sent2: The political landscape was in a constant state of fluxions.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors was a hilarious fluxions of misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were in a state of fluxions, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of fluxions in the abstract painting, symbolizing the unpredictability of life.
